intro: Orthoraphium coreanum var. kengii, commonly known as Korean orthoraphium, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinct, spicy scent when crushed. The flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters that attract various pollinators.
